alert.note: Alert for Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Louisa and north central Goochland Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 633 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Louisa, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hadensville around 710 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Orchid, Pendleton, Yanceyville, Louisa Airport, Fredericks Hall, Locust Creek, Apple Grove, Cuckoo and Wares Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Virginia.
